contentrichtext.text: {{Other people2|George Walsh (disambiguation)}} '''George H. Walsh''' (November 24, 1868–April 2, 1913) was an [[United States|American]] newspaper editor and publisher from [[Grand Forks, North Dakota]]. He served on the council of the [[Dakota Territory]] and was instrumental in the founding of the [[University of North Dakota]]. Walsh was one of the earliest settlers of Grand Forks. He was selected as a member of the Territorial Council, serving from 1879 until 1889. The council, in turn, elected him their President from 1879 until 1881. He also served in the [[North Dakota House of Representatives]] and was speaker When the territorial legislature authorized a new county in 1881, they named it [[Walsh County, North Dakota|Walsh County]] in his honor. Walsh County is immediately north of [[Grand Forks County, North Dakota|Grand Forks County]]. Walsh Hall at the University of North Dakota bears his name.<ref>[http://www.reshapingthetornadobelt.com/background/gfk-pioneer-biographies/george-h-walsh George H. Walsh]</ref> ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Walsh, George | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1868 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1913 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Walsh, George}} [[Category:1868 births]] [[Category:1913 deaths]] [[Category:People from Grand Forks, North Dakota]] [[Category:Members of the Dakota Territorial Legislature]] [[Category:Members of the North Dakota House of Representatives]] {{NorthDakota-politician-stub}} {{US-journalist-19thC-stub}} {{US-hist-stub}}
